page.title: 19THE HEARSE HOUSE IN SHAWHEAD
page.content: In 1814 the parish decided to have a hearse. One hundred and twenty six parishioners paid a subscription towards getting one. With the money they bought a horse-drawn hearse and a hearse house which cost Â£16 12s 6d. It still exists near Shawhead shop and is now a garage with the rent paid to the Church. The hearse was free to subscibers, others had to pay 4 shillings for under 10 miles and 5 shillings for over 10 miles. It was free to the poor. At a meeting, in December 1824, they decided to get a black box cloak to cover the hearse. Also at the meeting the driver was said to be picking up people and this was causing damage to the hearse. He was to be fined 5 shillings if it happened again.
